body_content.explanation: a situation in which a person, usually a child, is legally put under the care of a court or a guardian (= a person who has the legal right and responsibility of taking care of someone who cannot take care of himself or herself):
examples: The teenager became a ward of the court, but the wardship expired on his 18th birthday.
The wardship proceedings, which are still ongoing, will determine who will have custody of the child.
